w:HTMLPanel.title: PWT - Tutorial Part 3 - Build more pages

w:HTMLPanel.p: In this tutorial, we will will add some static content to the project inited in Part 2 : Build the Welcome Page
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 1 : Add new places and views
w:HTMLPanel.p: In the Part 2 we've seen how to add some place and views, so just add those two views / Places :

c:StaticCode.pre:
<!DOCTYPE ui:UiBinder SYSTEM "http://dl.google.com/gwt/DTD/xhtml.ent"> <ui:UiBinder xmlns:ui="urn:ui:com.google.gwt.uibinder" xmlns:w="urn:import:fr.putnami.pwt.core.widget.client">
<w:HTMLPanel> <w:Heading level="1" text="Contact" styleName="page-header"/> </w:HTMLPanel> </ui:UiBinder>

This application is the result of a step-by-step tutorial demonstrating the PWT features.

For more informations go to the repo hosting this tutorial

If you want to know more about the PWT framework, visit the project's page.

w:HTMLPanel.p: Finally, we declare the places to the MvpController in the entry point :
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 2 : Navigate between pages
w:HTMLPanel.p: To navigate between pages, you have to use the MvpController.goTo(Place) method.
So add a button to the "Welcome" view to navigate to the "About" view :
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 3 : Create a page decorator
w:HTMLPanel.p: At this point, when you navigate between pages, all the content of the page is replaced by the new content.
You may want to keep some static content beetween pages. To do so, we will create a decorator (implementing AcceptOneWidget) and set it as display associated with the ActivityManager.

c:StaticCode.pre:
.tutorialHeader { height : 65px; font-size: 30px; background-color:#EEE; } .tutorialFooter { text-align : center; background-color:#EEE; height: 80px; padding-top: 35px; }

w:HTMLPanel.p: And set the decorator as ActivityManager's display in the TutorialApp class :
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 4 : Add a NavBar
w:HTMLPanel.p: In the page decorator, we add a NavBar to navigate between places :

c:StaticCode.pre: <w:Header ...> ... </w:Header> <w:Navbar position="STATIC_TOP"> <w:Brand> <w:Anchor text="PWT Tutorial" link="#!" /> </w:Brand> <w:Nav> <w:NavLink label="Contact" link="#!Contact"/> <w:NavLink label="About" link="#!About"/> </w:Nav> </w:Navbar>

w:HTMLPanel.p: And if you want this NavBar to be static on the top when you scroll, simply put the NavBar in an Affix :

c:StaticCode.pre: <w:Affix> <w:Navbar position="STATIC_TOP"> <w:Brand> <w:Anchor text="PWT Tutorial" link="#!" /> </w:Brand> <w:Nav> <w:NavLink label="Contact" link="#!Contact"/> <w:NavLink label="About" link="#!About"/> </w:Nav> </w:Navbar> </w:Affix>

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 5 : Create I18N template
w:HTMLPanel.p: With PWT, you can use different templates for different locales. We will use a different template for the french locale (the button is out of the Jumbotron with a different icon) in the file fr/putnami/pwt/tutorial/client/welcome/WelcomeView_fr.ui.xml

c:StaticCode.pre: Bienvenue sur l'application de tutoriel de PWT.

w:HTMLPanel.p: Then add the fr locale in the module xml file (fr/putnami/pwt/tutorial/Tutorial.gwt.xml):
And in order to show the result in dev or superDev mode, remove the "collapse locale property" in the dev module xml file (fr/putnami/pwt/tutorial/TutorialDev.gwt.xml):

c:StaticCode.pre: <!-- Disabled to test I18N templates in dev --> <!-- <collapse-property name="locale" values="*" /> -->

w:HTMLPanel.p: Then go to http://localhost:8080/putnami-pwt-tutorial/?locale=fr to see the french version of the welcome page.
Go to http://localhost:8080/putnami-pwt-tutorial/?locale=en to see the default version.

w:Alert.p: You can see the result in the tutorials/Part3 folder in the PWT sources.
